avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs have widely formed in high elevations after continuous SW and N winds, especially in gullies. Older snow is considered stable. Beware of terrain traps.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Wind slabs are widely found, especially in high elevations after continuous SW- and N- winds. Snow is widely wind packed and ice layers can be found in the snowpack. Stability test showed no response. Older snow is considered stable but beware of terrain traps. New windslabs can form in NW aspects on Friday in stiff SE wind.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed in NE winds with most intensity in the Eastfjords. Wind slabs have formed widely after ongoing SW snowfall last week followed by N winds. These wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions. Freezing temperatures dominated last week and weakness could have further developed in the snowpack as a consequence. It got slightly warmer throughout the weekend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions.

weatherForecast.highlights: Tíðindalítið veður en líkur á slydduéljum eða éljum á fimmtudagskvöld. Fer að hvessa úr suðaustri á föstudag, hlýnandi veður.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche fell in N-aspect in Súgandafjörður on Monday. Small collapses have been seen in W-facing hills this weekend. Two avalanches released in Súðavíkurhlíð on 6.2. in NW winds, one of them closed the road. Two avalanches fell on and right by the same road early on 3.2. after ongoing SW winds.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Layered wind slabs are in all aspects. Observations indicate multiple weak layers in the snowpack and increased likelihood of human triggered avalanches. Compressions tests in the area gave a sudden collapse with medium load.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Layered wind slabs are in all aspects and weaknesses have been found between layers. Snow pits in the area from the 7th, 8th and 10th of February confirm this and compression tests have given a sudden collapse at 10-40 cm depth. Even though there is still rather little snow in mountains for the season, people travelling in steep terrain should be careful. There is an increased risk of human triggered avalanches that can be dangerous. In the cold weather, weak layers should have been preserved.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed in NE winds with most intensity in the Eastfjords. Wind slabs have formed widely after ongoing SW snowfall last week followed by N winds. These wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions. Freezing temperatures dominated last week and weakness could have further developed in the snowpack as a consequence. It got slightly warmer throughout the weekend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions.

weatherForecast.highlights: SV-átt og snjókoma á miðvikudag, hægari V- og NV-átt á miðvikudagskvöld. Úrkomulaust og hægur vindur á fimmtudag og föstudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: A 40 m wide and up to 1 m thick slab was triggered by a snowmobile in a steep S-facing hill 10.2. An avalanche was spotted in Auðnahyrna 8.2, probably from 7th of Feb. An avalanche was spotted in Skarðsdalsvik 7.2. on a west facing slope. A slab avalanche was spotted on Tuesday morning 7.2. in a south facing gully in Bakkadalur. A slab avalanche fell over the road Ólafsfjarðarvegur on 6.2 east facing. Earlier the same morning, an avalanche released in Ólafsfjarðarmúli, but it was smaller and stopped above the road. A few slab avalanches were recorded early last weekend in various aspects, above Ólafsfjarðarvegur and elsewhere in the area.
avalancheActivity.highlights: About 40 m wide slab was triggered 10.2. in a steep S-facing hill in Upsadalur close to Dalvík. Unstable windslabs should be expected in steep slopes, both in south and north facing aspcets. New windslabs are expected to form in stiff SW wind on Wednesday. Whumps noticed widely in the forecasting area.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Wind slabs from NE- and N wind and snow early this week but temperature was around freezing point by sea level, causing wetter snow below 150 m elevation. Older windslabs can be found in S and N aspects and new wind slabs form in stiff SW wind on Wednesday. A layered snowpack from Skarðsdalur snowpit (7.2) with CT collapse with medium load. Weak layer with facets deeper in snowpack. ECTP17 with planar fracture between a hard slab and the firn below in Vatnsendahnjúkur W-face in Héðinsfjörður 11.2 and some whumps noticed. Whumps noticed in Svarfaðadalur, Héðinsfjörður and Karlsárdalur and the sledge triggered slab in Upsadalur 10.2. show that persistent windslabs can be tricky.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed in NE winds with most intensity in the Eastfjords. Wind slabs have formed widely after ongoing SW snowfall last week followed by N winds. These wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions. Freezing temperatures dominated last week and weakness could have further developed in the snowpack as a consequence. It got slightly warmer throughout the weekend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions.

weatherForecast.highlights: Gengur í hvassa SV-átt á miðvikudag og fer að snjóa um kvöldið. Styttir upp, lægir og léttir til á fimmtudag og föstudag, kalt í veðri.

avalancheActivity.comment: Three avalanches in Strandartindu in Seyðisfjörður and Two above Neskaupstaður on Monday. Small avalanche in inner Bræðslugjá by Neskaupstaður from 7th or 8th of February.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Much snow was been added on Sunday and Monday, especially around Seyðisfjörður. Windslabs in easterly and southerly aspects, especially in gullies and lows, after strong NW-N wind and snowshowers.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Much snow was been added on Sunday and Monday, especially around Seyðisfjörður and drifted in NE-E winds. Before were new windslabs in easterly and southerly aspects, especially in gullies and lows, after strong NW-N wind and snowshowers. The windslanbs may be unstable. High in mountains there are older windslabs that may be porly bonded with harder older snow. In lower part of mountains older snow is considered stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed in NE winds with most intensity in the Eastfjords. Wind slabs have formed widely after ongoing SW snowfall last week followed by N winds. These wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions. Freezing temperatures dominated last week and weakness could have further developed in the snowpack as a consequence. It got slightly warmer throughout the weekend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions.

weatherForecast.highlights: Minnkandi NV-átt á miðvikudag, síðan hægari V-átt á fimmtudag og föstudag og úrkomulaust.
